title: How to Choose the Best Render Settings on Blender

steps.headline: Choose a resolution.
steps.description: 1920x1080px is the default, but you might want to change it. Also, below it, try using a smaller (proportional) size. 100% is the size you specified at the right. 50% will cut rendering time to about 1/4 or more, so use that for previewing.

steps.headline: Click on the render layers you need for rendering, and compositing afterwards.
steps.description: If you are not compositing, you will not need to choose Layer settings.

steps.headline: Choose the shading options.
steps.description: These will affect your render quality, and speed. Disable one or two to for just previewing your work.

steps.headline: Choose an anti-aliasing sample number.
steps.description: The higher the number, the better the render will be, at the cost of time.

steps.headline: Add motion blur, if you want.
Select 'Do Composite' if you are using composite nodes.
Choose your correct Performance settings.
steps.description: It should be fine by default, but make sure, if this is wrong your render times will be slower by a lot.

steps.headline: Hit render!
steps.description: F12 or the Render Image or Animation button. Also choose if you want to see the render on another window or in the main window.
